pullRequest.title: Add missing invalidate calls to CachingHiveMetastore + Fix REVOKE in FileHiveMetastore

nodes.bodyText:
CachingHiveMetastore didn't work correctly with GRANT/REVOKE

Instead of saying what was broken, please describe how it got improved. I would say:
Respect GRANT and REVOKE CachingHiveMetastore
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,119 @@
+package io.prestosql.plugin.hive.metastore.cache;

nodes.bodyText: extend io.prestosql.testing.AbstractTestQueryFramework
AfterMethod(alwaysRun =true)
ImmutableMap
Please fix file based metastore in separate commit
This does not look like related to GRANT/REVOKE. Please extract this as separate commit.
what about grant and revoke for roles?
It is strange that you GRANT something that is created in test (line 112).
I would test GRANT table privileges and GRANT role independently. Now it is not known what caused cache to flush. We need to make sure that cache is flushed properly for any of these.
Let's define data provider under the usage.

I don’t see why we need to duplicate the list of caches just to invalidate them. The old code seems fine. This change is unrelated to fixing grant/revoke, so please make a separate PR and we can discuss it independently.

static import,
closer for single usage is an overkill to me.
now it is buggy in different way. Still someone might forget to add a cache to caches. Please undo the refactor or please make a separate PR and we can discuss it

listTablePrivileges is called with Optional.empty() for principal when we want to access all privileges. It is set when when we want to access specific user privileges.
I think adding a comment to code could be nice here.

Commit message:
Add missing cache invalidate calls to CachingHiveMetastore is implementation detail, however the more important aspect is user visiable behavior change. Also please do not use - in commit message title.
I would write:
Invalidate Hive metastore cache on GRANT/REVOKE

- Add missing cache invalidate calls to CachingHiveMetastore
- Fix REVOKE in FileHiveMetastore

will split into 3 commits a moment before merge

A person who merge and so accepts the code has to see the code in a form it is going to be merged.
Anyway, I think it could stay as it is now. Single commit is not perfect here, but it is good enough.
Just FYI there is io.prestosql.sql.query.QueryAssertions
Use io.prestosql.plugin.hive.HiveQueryRunner#builder then you don't have to play with metastore directory.
you need to close query runner here.
private static
public
com.google.common.collect.Sets#cartesianProduct(java.util.Set<? extends B>...)?
This is no longer needed

commit.message: Respect GRANT and REVOKE in CachingHiveMetastore
